Rig Veda, tr. by Ralph T.H. Griffith, [1896], at sacred-texts.com

HYMN CLXXI. Indra.

1. FOR Iṭa's sake who pressed the juice, thou, Indra, didst protect his car,
And hear the Soma-giver's call.
2 Thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swift-moving combatant,
And sought the Soma-pourer's home.
3 Venya, that mortal man, hast thou, for Āstrabudhna the devout,
O Indra, many a time set free.
4 Bring, Indra, to the east again that Sun who now is in the west,
Even against the will of Gods.

Next: HYMN CLXXII. Dawn.

data.title: HYMN CLXXI. Indra.
data.feecting:
p:FOR Iṭa's sake who pressed the juice Indra, didst protect his car, and hear the Soma-giver's call.
p:Thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swift-moving combatant, and sought the Soma-pourer's home.
p:Venya, that mortal man, hast thou, for Āstrabudhna the devout, O Indra, many a time set free.
p:Bring, Indra, to the east again that Sun who now is in the west, Even against the will of Devas.
